thread.title: Friday preview: Eurozone GDP and inflation reports in the spotlight
thread.title_full: Friday preview: Eurozone GDP and inflation reports in the spotlight

title: Friday preview: Eurozone GDP and inflation reports in the spotlight
text:
570.86 +6.36 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - Eurozone inflation and economic growth data will on Friday provide some indication on whether the European Central Bank's efforts to improve the health of the bloc are working. Analysts predict Eurozone gross domestic product rose 1.3% year-on-year in the second quarter, compared to the previous three month's 1% gain. 
A final reading of the consumer price index is expected to be confirmed at 0.2% in the year to July. It has remained well below the ECB's target of just under 2% growth but has risen since January, when it contracted 0.6%. 
In its account of the governing council meeting in mid-July, released on Thursday, the ECB said the Eurozone is finally seeing a pick-up in inflation. 
Policymakers pointed to a "growing number of indications that a turning point [on inflation] might well have been reached". They said it was too soon to tell, however, and "additional observations would be needed". 
The officials also expressed some concern that financial developments in China could have a larger-than-expected adverse impact, given the country's prominent role in global trade. 
The central bank said the risk could be compounded by negative knock-on effects from interest rate by the US Federal Reserve on growth in emerging market economies. 
On an upbeat note, the ECB said risks stemming from developments in Greece appeared to be generally contained. 
"It was also felt that recently improved prospects for the negotiations of a third financial programme for Greece could be expected to contribute to a firming of confidence across the euro area," it said.
